H0.text: Resistors are electrical wires coated with a rubber or plastic because these materials are good.

H1.text: Magnets are materials that are good for coating electrical wires with rubber or plastic, which is why electrical wires are coated with these materials.

H2.text: Insulators are materials, such as rubber or plastic, that are good enough to coat electrical wires.

H3.text: Conductors are materials that are good for electrical wires coated with rubber or plastic.

A4.text: Flexible insulating materials such as PVC (polyvinyl chloride) are used to insulate the circuit and prevent human contact with a 'live' wire â€“ one having voltage of 600 volts or less.

A5.text: Insulators are used in electrical equipment to support and separate electrical conductors without allowing current through themselves.
